data.title: Case Study 4
data.meta_description: CASE STUDY 4 - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. Oracle pursued horizontal acquisitions to grow its database software business, acquiring 8 companies. This helped diversify Oracle's revenue streams and risks. CVS acquired pharmacy benefits managers and other companies vertically to integrate its supply chain and benefit from economies of scale. Both companies faced regulatory challenges and competition in their industries. Oracle addressed weaknesses in marketing and R&D through acquisitions, while CVS opportunities included diversifying through related mergers and facing threats from imitators and regulations.
